ADD-DATA-PAGE.DefaultStatusText: Drop or click here to add file
ADD-DATA-PAGE.Disclaimer-1: Use of this functionality is subject to the NRCAN DataHub
ADD-DATA-PAGE.Instructions: Select your data to upload to your personal account. Fill out the information below to describe your dataset.
ADD-DATA-PAGE.OverwriteFilePrompt: A file named '{0}' already exists. Do you want to add a new version?
ADD-DATA-PAGE.Protected-B-Warning-1: Currently DataHub does not permit storage of Protected B data or above.
ADD-DATA-PAGE.Protected-B-Warning-2: Please only upload Unclassified or Protected A files.

BANNER-PAGE.SlideText-1: Gain rapid insights into your data for better decisions
BANNER-PAGE.SlideText-2: Take your files with you anywhere you go
BANNER-PAGE.SlideText-3: Explore new technologies and experiment without limits

ERROR-PAGE.Title: Error has occured
ERROR-PAGE.Prompt: A fatal error has occured, please contact system admin for clarification.
ERROR-PAGE.SomethingWentWrong-Label: Something went wrong. Please try again later.
ERROR-PAGE.ErrorExplanation-Text: An error has happened on the DataHub server. The team has been notified and the error has been recorded. The correlation ID for this error is <>. To avoid network issues, if you are currently on the VPN, please try to disconnect the VPN and retry your actions.
ERROR-PAGE.AttemptingToReConnect-Label: Attempting to re-connect with server, please wait...
ERROR-PAGE.FailedToConnect-Label: Failed to connect, please try again later
ERROR-PAGE.ConnectionRefused-Label: Connection refused, please try again later
ERROR-PAGE.ConnectionLost-Label: Connection lost, please refresh this page

FILE-GRID-PAGE.ConfirmDeletePrompt: Are you sure you want to permenantly delete '{0}'?

SECTION-1.Line1: Welcome to NRCAN DataHub - we hope your experience is a great one!
SECTION-1.Line2: If you need anything at all, please do not hesitate to reach out to us.  Your feedback drives our development of new features and allows us to squash any annoying little bugs that you may find along the way.  So please do not hesitate to send us an email to our support mailbox.  We promise we will read and respond to everyone!
SECTION-1.Title: Thanks for giving us a try

SECTION-2.Line1: As a part of the Limited Release Team, we are giving you early access to our Alpha release.  We hope that you will take the time to use the platform as much as possible to become familiar with its features.  This will enable us to get some insight into what works and what does not.
SECTION-2.Line2: Over the next few weeks, we will be putting the platform through the ringer by 'simulating' a few real-world scenarios while you continue to use the platform.  These simulations will include things like service failure and recovery, hundreds of simultaneous users, and other exciting tests.  We hope that you will not notice any of these activities but, if you do, please grab a screenshot or shoot us an email to tell us about your experience.  We would very much appreciate some insight into what worked and what did not.  We may also ask you for feedback in the form of a short survey or group discussion.  This will help us to further narrow down any issues that may arise.
SECTION-2.Line3: Thank you again for participating and we look forward to speaking with you in the near future!
SECTION-2.Title: What can you expect?

SECTION-3.Line1: This is your own personal storage space!  It is intended for your use and enjoyment.
SECTION-3.Line2: Please feel free to upload and share files with your colleagues on the Limited Release Team or the Developers.  You have 100GB of storage space that you can use in whatever way you like.  We encourage you to try uploading, sharing and searching for files of various types.  There may even be some Easter Eggs (datasets) so keep an eye out for those.
SECTION-3.Line3: Enjoy and let us know if you have any questions!
SECTION-3.Title: Securely store all of your data

APPROVAL-FORM.Dataset_Title_TXT: Title of Dataset(s) or Information Resource(s)
APPROVAL-FORM.Copyright_Restrictions_FLAG: There are no known legal, licensing, or copyright restrictions to prevent the data or information from being released by the department or agency under the terms of the Open Government Licence – Canada.
APPROVAL-FORM.Authority_To_Release_FLAG: The department or agency has the departmental mandate, legislative authority or permission from a third party provider to publish the data or information resource under the Open Government Licence – Canada.
APPROVAL-FORM.Private_Personal_Information_FLAG: The data or information resource does not contain any personal information as defined in section 3 of the Privacy Act, R.S.C. 1985, c. P-21 as confirmed by the ATIP Secretariat.
APPROVAL-FORM.Subject_To_Exceptions_Or_Eclusions_FLAG: The data or information resource is not subject to any exemptions or exclusions under Section 13 “Exemptions” or Section 68 “Exclusions” of the Access to Information Act, R.S.C 1985 as confirmed by the ATIP Secretariat.
APPROVAL-FORM.Not_Clasified_Or_Protected_FLAG: The data or information resource is not Classified or Protected and its release complies with the Government of Canada Policy on Government Security.
APPROVAL-FORM.Can_Be_Released_For_Free_FLAG: The data or information resource can be released to the public without fee.
APPROVAL-FORM.Machine_Readable_FLAG: A) Datasets are provided in machine-readable / machine-processable format.
APPROVAL-FORM.Non_Propietary_Format_FLAG: B) Information resources are provided in open, non-proprietary formats.
APPROVAL-FORM.Localized_Metadata_FLAG: Metadata in both official languages conforming to the applicable Government of Canada metadata standard is provided for each dataset or information resource.
APPROVAL-FORM.Updated_On_Going_Basis_FLAG: Existing dataset will be updated on an on-going basis.
APPROVAL-FORM.Collection_Of_Datasets_FLAG: Represents a collection of datasets or data products with a consistently applied specification or model.
APPROVAL-FORM.Approval_InSitu_FLAG: Represents a series of observation data, such as data collected from in-situ sensors.

METADATA-PAGE.TranslationNote: Note that all text is translated using a third party tool and is only a suggested translation. It is the responsibility of the user to validate the translation before submitting the metadata.

FGP-WIZARD.Approval_Filled_out_3: Paste the GCdocs file link (https://gcdocs.gc.ca/nrcan-rncan/llisapi.dll/link/XXXXXXXX) in the section below.
FGP-WIZARD.CancelSharingDescription: You can cancel this request to share the data file before it is approved. The request to share will be deleted from system. Once approved, you will not be able to cancel the request.

PUBLIC-SHARING-WORKFLOW.Title: Data Sharing
PUBLIC-SHARING-WORKFLOW.OpenDataDesc: This workflow will enable to upload your data to the Canada Open Data Portal. It includes the metadata management and approvals.
PUBLIC-SHARING-WORKFLOW.PublicUrlDesc: This workflow will generate public links (data-nrcan.canada.ca, donnees-rncan.canada.ca) from your files to reference them on external sites or publications.

PUBLIC-URL-APPROVAL.Title: Public URL Sharing Request
PUBLIC-URL-APPROVAL.Description: You may approve or deny this file sharing request, and optionally specify a publication date after which the file will be publicly accessible. Additionally, you may specify or change the expiration date after which the public link will no longer be active.

ValidationErrors.PubDateInPast: Publication date cannot be in the past.
ValidationErrors.PubDateAfterExpiry: Expiration date must be after publication date.
ValidationErrors.TempWithNoExpiry: Expiration date must be specified when temporary sharing is enabled.

STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.Title: Storage Cost Estimator
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara1: This tool can be used to estimate the initial migration cost as well as the monthly cost in CAD$ for an Azure storage solution using the Block Blob v2 service.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara2: Proceed by entering the parameters in this form to the best of your knowledge and the cost estimate will be calculated and displayed below. You can then send yourself a copy of the estimate by email.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara3: Before using this tool, please read and accept the following statement:
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.PriceListLastUpdated: This estimate is based on Azure storage prices for the Canada Central region, last fetched on {0}.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateDisclaimer: I understand that this tool provides an estimate of the cost based on the specified parameters, and the actual cost may vary based on real-world usage factors such as the actual amount of data, access patterns, etc.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.MoreInfoIntro: For more information, please expand the following sections:
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.MicrosoftDocNote: These definitions are based on Microsoft Azure documentation. For more details, please consult the official Microsoft website.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.HotTierExplanation: The Hot tier is optimized for storing data that is accessed or modified frequently. It has the highest storage costs, but the lowest access costs.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.CoolTierExplanation: The Cool tier is optimized for storing data that is infrequently accessed or modified, that should be stored for a minimum of 30 days. It has lower storage costs and higher access costs compared to the Hot tier.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.ArchiveTierExplanation: Archive is an 'offline' tier optimized for storage of data that is rarely accessed, with flexible latency requirements on the order of hours. Data in the Archive tier should be stored for a minimum of 180 days.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.LRSExplanation: Locally redundant storage (LRS) copies your data synchronously three times within a single physical location in the primary region. LRS is the least expensive replication option, but is not recommended for applications requiring high availability or durability.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.ZRSExplanation: Zone-redundant storage (ZRS) copies your data synchronously across three Azure availability zones in the primary region. For applications requiring high availability, Microsoft recommends using ZRS in the primary region, and also replicating to a secondary region.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.GRSExplanation: Geo-redundant storage (GRS) copies your data synchronously three times within a single physical location in the primary region using LRS. It then copies your data asynchronously to a single physical location in the secondary region. Within the secondary region, your data is copied synchronously three times using LRS.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.NoArchiveZRSNote: Note: The Archive tier is not supported with ZRS redundancy.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateEmailIntro: Here is the storage cost estimate for the first year, using the specified parameters. Please note that this is only an estimate, and actual cost may vary due to factors including amount of data and usage patterns.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateEmailAdminIntro: User {0}({1}) has generated this Azure storage cost estimate:

COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.Title: Compute Cost Estimator
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara1: This tool can be used to give a rough estimate of Databricks compute cost in CAD$ for a given workload.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara2: Proceed by entering the parameters in this form, and the cost estimate will be calculated and displayed below. You can then send yourself a copy of the estimate by email.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara3: Before using this tool, please read and accept the following statement:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.PriceListLastUpdated: This estimate is based on Azure Databricks and compute prices for the Canada Central region, last fetched on {0}.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateDisclaimer: I understand that this tool provides an estimate of the cost based on the specified parameters, and the actual cost may vary based on real-world usage factors.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.MoreInfoIntro: For more information, please expand the following sections:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.WorkloadTypesP1: This tool uses a set of workloads designed to represent a broad range of usage scenarios. The workloads use these machine specs:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.WorkloadTypesP2: Each workload uses several instances of these machines:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.CostsP1: Each workload is billed based on the virtual machines provisioned for the task, as well as the Databricks Units (DBUs) used.

UserEmail.EstimateEmailIntro: Here is your Databricks compute cost estimate, using the specified parameters. Please note that this is only an estimate, and actual cost may vary due to real-world usage and workload factors.

AdminEmail.EstimateEmailAdminIntro: User {0}({1}) has generated this Databricks compute cost estimate:
